intro: Canthium triacanthum, commonly known as the three-armed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Canthium triacanthum is typically found in open woodlands and disturbed habitats.
